patient_question: My neck and shoulders are always tight and painful. Can acupuncture help?
clinic_answer: Neck and shoulder pain often responds well to acupuncture and TCM treatment. By improving circulation, relaxing tense muscles, and reducing inflammation through a course of treatments, many patients experience significant relief. Combining acupuncture with herbal remedies and lifestyle adjustments maximizes results.
tcm_focus_area: Bi syndrome; Qi and Blood stagnation in channels
professional_acupuncture_points: GB20 (Fengchi), GB21 (Jianjing), SI3 (Houxi), BL10 (Tianzhu), LI4 (Hegu), SI11 (Tianzong), Ashi points
tcm_trigger_acupuncture_points: GB20 (Fengchi), LI4 (Hegu), GB21 (Jianjing) - Use for acute activation and trigger point release
pharmacopeia: Juyuanzi, Xuefu Zhuyu Tang, Gui Zhi Shao Yao Zhi Mu Tang - Circulation tonics and Bi syndrome herbs

patient_question: I have chronic low back pain from sitting or an old injury. What can you do?
clinic_answer: TCM addresses chronic low back pain through acupuncture, cupping therapy, and herbal medicine. This integrated approach reduces pain, improves mobility, strengthens the lower back, and addresses underlying constitutional patterns that contribute to long-term healing.
tcm_focus_area: Kidney weakness; channel obstruction; Cold-Damp
professional_acupuncture_points: BL23 (Shenshu), BL40 (Weizhong), BL25 (Dachangshu), GV3 (Yaoyangguan), GV4 (Mingmen), KI3 (Taixi), Ashi points
tcm_trigger_acupuncture_points: GV3 (Yaoyangguan), BL23 (Shenshu), KI3 (Taixi) - Use for trigger point release and kidney energy restoration
pharmacopeia: Du Zhong, Eucommiae Cortex, Sang Ji Sheng, Xu Duan - Lower back tonics and pain relieving formulas

patient_question: This is a sample patient question about wellness issue 3. How can TCM help?
clinic_answer: TCM assessment is individualized; the therapist would take a full history and tongue-pulse reading, then design a treatment plan combining acupuncture, lifestyle advice, and where appropriate herbal support.
tcm_focus_area: Pattern differentiation according to TCM principles
professional_acupuncture_points: ST36 (Zusanli), LI4 (Hegu), SP6 (Sanyinjiao), LV3 (Taichong), PC6 (Neiguan), GV20 (Baihui) - Foundational wellness protocol
tcm_trigger_acupuncture_points: ST36 (Zusanli), LI4 (Hegu) - Primary trigger and circulation points
pharmacopeia: Pattern-specific herbal formula per TCM diagnosis
